N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 179.7 - Amount of operating aid to public radio stations

State Regulations

Such funds as are annually appropriated to assist approved
radio programming operational expenses shall be divided equally among eligible
public radio stations and public television and radio corporations. However, such grants to any one station or corporation shall not exceed that station's
or corporation's approved program operating expenses nor its nonfederal income
from the previous fiscal year. Approved program operating expenses, for
purposes of this provision, shall include the cost of transmission, a full-time
manager, professional writers, producers, directors, talent, technicians, the
rental, lease or purchase of recorded program materials, and production; overhead costs shall not be included in such calculations. Such funds provided
by the State shall be limited in use for the operation of the radio
service. Notes
